TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ControlDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides a base control designer class for extending the design-mode behavior of a Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ControlDesigner class provides a base control designer class that can be inherited from and extended to provide design-time support for a Web server control in a design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
The object model for working with design-time rendering is improved over earlier versions, with the following new base classes to provide access to the simplified object model:
- ControlDesigner, which is not new, but has been greatly improved.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner>.
## Automatic Formatting You can create a variety of automatic and pre-defined formats that can simplify the process of page developers who are applying complex style changes to custom Web server controls. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.TableDesigner> control, which derives from the ControlDesigner class, provides many automatic formats from which to choose. To implement and provide automatic formatting in your custom controls, use the following features:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnAutoFormatApplied%2A> method.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> class.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatStyle> class.
## Action Lists (Smart Tags) Action lists are menus of important or widely used tasks that a page developer who uses a control can perform in a design-time user interface (UI), such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]. For example, the design-time view of your control could provide a menu of available tasks. This includes a task to format the control automatically. To learn about action lists, start with the following features:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property.
- The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class.
- The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.
- The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class.
- The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem> class.
- The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem> class.
## Control Designer Regions Regions are editable areas in the design-time view of a Web server control. This feature offers WYSIWYG-like editing of the template content, inner controls, and properties at design time. You can have the control designer create controls in regions or you can use the Toolbox to drag and drop controls into regions. Regions are managed with the following features:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A> method.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> class.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> class.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.
## Templates The model for creating a UI for design-time editing of templated controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, has been greatly improved from earlier versions. You can create complex custom controls that include templates for various parts of the control, and your custom control designer can help page developers who are modifying templates with the following features:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InTemplateMode%2A> property.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> class.
## Design-Time Rendering The ControlDesigner class has the following methods to support design-time rendering of the Web server control. Most of these methods are the same as in earlier versions:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.UpdateDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a simple designer class that derives from the ControlDesigner class. This control designer supports a custom `TextControl` class and provides a command to change the text size of a control at design time. The control designer is associated with the control by specifying the control designer in a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> object declaration on the `TextControl` class. The key to persisting property changes from the control designer to the HTML markup is found in the `ToggleTextSize` method of the custom `ActionList` class.
To try the example, add a reference to the System.Design.dll assembly and compile the code.
[!code-vb[ControlDesignerSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.c_5_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ControlDesignerSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.c_5_1.cs)] [!code-cs[ControlDesignerSample#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.c_5_2.aspx)] [!code-vb[ControlDesignerSample#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.c_5_2.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the action list collection for the control designer.
Docs.value: A object that contains the items for the control designer.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a simple composite control with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control, together with properties to set the Text properties on both internal controls, and also the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control. An associated control designer class creates three <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem> commands, each of which sets two properties on the control, and can be rolled back with the undo functionality of the design host.
[!code-vb[DesignerInvokeTransactedChange#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.design.c_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[DesignerInvokeTransactedChange#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.design.c_0_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control can be resized in the design-time environment.
Docs.value: , if the control can be resized; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the AllowResize property in a custom control designer class.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property.
[!code-cs[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.design.c_4_1.cs)] [!code-vb[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.design.c_4_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of predefined automatic formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box for the associated control at design time.
Docs.value: A object that contains the predefined schemes for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A complete Web server control includes not only the control, but also, possibly, a corresponding control designer class that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class and a formatting class that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> class. The AutoFormats property is a collection of instances of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> class. For a working example of automatic formatting in [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to implement the AutoFormats property in a custom control designer. The derived control designer implements the AutoFormats property by adding three instances of a custom automatic format that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> class.
[!code-vb[DesignerAutoFormat#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.design.c_2_1.vb)] [!code-cs[DesignerAutoFormat#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.design.c_2_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance string CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml(string errorMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message to include in the generated HTML markup.
Docs.summary: Creates HTML markup to display a specified error message at design time.
Docs.returns: An HTML markup string that contains the specified error message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml method to create HTML markup to display an error message for a control at design time. The value for `errorMessage` specifies a localized string that is displayed to the user of the control at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class implementation of the CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml method returns a table with two rows, as follows:
- The first row contains the type name and site name for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Component%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> object.
- The second row contains the input error message string.
To generate HTML markup for an error message with an associated exception, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml%28System.String%2CSystem.Exception%29> overload. To generate HTML markup for an exception without specifying a localized error message, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: protected string CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml (string errorMessage, Exception e);
.method familyhidebysig instance string CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml(string errorMessage, class System.Exception e) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message to include in the generated HTML string.
The exception to include in the generated HTML string.
Docs.summary: Creates the HTML markup to display a specified exception error message at design time.
Docs.returns: HTML markup that contains the specified and .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml method to provide simple HTML markup that can be used to display error and exception details for a control at design time. The value for `errorMessage` specifies a localized string that is displayed to the user of the control at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class implementation of the CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml method returns a table with two rows, as follows:
- The first row contains the type name and site name for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Component%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>object.
- The second row contains the input error message and the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> string of the exception.
To generate HTML markup for an error message without specifying an exception, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.CreateErrorDesignTimeHtml%28System.String%29> overload. To generate HTML markup for an exception without specifying a localized error message, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance string CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides a simple rectangular placeholder representation that displays the type and ID of the control.
Docs.returns: A string that contains design-time HTML markup providing basic information about the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance string CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml(string instruction) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that contains text and markup to add to the HTML output.
Docs.summary: Provides a simple rectangular placeholder representation that displays the type and ID of the control, and also additional specified instructions or information.
Docs.returns: A string that contains design-time HTML markup providing information about the control.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a templated control designer. A string is then passed as the `instruction` parameter in a call to the CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml method, which provides the design-time HTML markup.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property.
[!code-cs[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/9bd5081d-6260-453b-a123-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/9bd5081d-6260-453b-a123-_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.Control CreateViewControl() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a copy of the associated control for viewing or rendering on the design surface.
Gets a value indicating whether data binding is supported by the containing region for the associated control.
Docs.value: , if the container for the control supports data binding; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets an object that is used to persist data for the associated control at design time.
Docs.value: A DesignerState property that implements <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> and uses the to persist state data for the associated control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The values for the DesignerState property are persisted even if the user switches from Design to Source view, or reloads the document, or closes and reopens the design host.
You can get and set values in the returned object as you would in an IDictionary object, with the values automatically persisted.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Error: This property can no longer be referenced, and is included to support existing compiled applications. The design-time element view architecture is no longer used. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202", true)

Docs.summary: Gets the view-control object for the control designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The DesignTimeElementView property is obsolete and there is no replacement for the functionality.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the design host must finish loading before the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method can be called.
Docs.value: , if loading must be complete before the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method can be called; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default implementation of the DesignTimeHtmlRequiresLoadComplete property returns `false`.
> [!NOTE] > The DesignTimeHtmlRequiresLoadComplete property is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.SetViewFlags%2A> method for equivalent control designer functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Drawing.Rectangle GetBounds() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the coordinates of the rectangle representing the boundaries for the control as displayed on the design surface.
Docs.returns: A object representing the boundaries for the control on the design surface relative to the control, not the document.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the HTML markup that is used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: The HTML markup used to represent the control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the GetDesignTimeHtml method in a custom control designer. If the Text property for the associated control is empty, the GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method. Otherwise, the GetDesignTimeHtml method creates and renders a Hyperlink control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner_Example#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.design.c_4_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner_Example#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.c_4_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of control designer regions for the associated control.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the HTML markup to display the control and populates the collection with the current control designer regions.
Docs.returns: The design-time HTML markup for the associated control, including all control designer regions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The design host calls the GetDesignTimeHtml method to get the design-time HTML markup and the current list of control designer regions. Using the DesignerRegionCollection, the design host can then request the markup for each editable control designer region.
The GetDesignTimeHtml method is provided for a derived control designer, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class, that must process the content for the region before calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create HTML markup using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> collection.
[!code-vb[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/193e5c9b-34a9-4c58-9756-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/193e5c9b-34a9-4c58-9756-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignTimeResourceProviderFactory GetDesignTimeResourceProviderFactory(class System.IServiceProvider serviceProvider) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.IServiceProvider> object that can retrieve global and local services.
Docs.summary: Returns an appropriate resource provider factory, depending on the globalization settings in the configuration file for the site.
Docs.returns: A object, if any are defined in the configuration file; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A resource provider factory creates resource providers and resource writers, depending on the current settings in the system.web/globalization section of the configuration file (either the Machine.config or Web.config files for both global and local resources). If no globalization settings are found, the `serviceProvider` parameter is used to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignTimeResourceProviderFactory> object using the default implementation for the design host.
Typically, control developers will not override the GetDesignTimeResourceProviderFactory method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to get content for.
Docs.summary: Returns the content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.
Docs.returns: The persisted content for the region, if the control designer supports editable regions; otherwise, an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default implementation of the GetEditableDesignerRegionContent method returns an empty string ("").
Classes deriving from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class can support region-based editing on the design surface and override the GetEditableDesignerRegionContent method to return the content for a specified region.
## Examples The following code example shows how to get a reference to the design host, and then use the reference to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlParser> object that creates the HTML markup for `region` and its contents.
[!code-vb[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/0859debc-20bb-4091-ad4c-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/0859debc-20bb-4091-ad4c-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the HTML markup to represent a Web server control at design time that will have no visual representation at run time.
Docs.returns: The HTML markup used to represent a control at design time that would otherwise have no visual representation. The default is a rectangle that contains the type and ID of the component.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default behavior of the GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml method is to return a string that contains the name of the component. The GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml method should be called in the implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method when there is no design-time HTML markup.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a custom control designer. If the `Text` property for the associated control is empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method calls GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml method. Otherwise, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method creates and renders a `Hyperlink` control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner_Example#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.design.c_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner_Example#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.c_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed

Docs.param: The exception that occurred.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the HTML markup that provides information about the specified exception.
Docs.returns: The design-time HTML markup for the specified exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetErrorDesignTimeHtml method is typically called, if an exception is thrown in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to generate design-time HTML markup for the control when an error occurs and call the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.design.c_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.c_0_1.vb)]

Docs.returns: A string representing the persistable inner HTML markup for the associated control. The default is .

Docs.summary: Retrieves an object that contains the design-time markup for the content and regions of the associated control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Web.UI.Design.ViewRendering GetViewRendering(class System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner designer) cil managed

Docs.param: A control designer that derives from .
Docs.summary: Retrieves an object that contains the design-time markup for the content and regions of the associated control for the specified control designer.
Gets a value indicating whether the properties of the associated control are hidden when the control is in template mode.
Docs.value: , if the properties of the associated control are hidden when the control is in template mode; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ID property is never hidden. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method uses the HidePropertiesInTemplateMode property to determine whether properties, other than the ID property, should be hidden from the property grids while the control is in template editing mode.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ID { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ID string for the control.
Docs.value: The ID string for the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ID property is used internally within the control designer and for interaction with the Properties window. The ID property shadows the run-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.param: The control being designed.
Docs.summary: Initializes the control designer and loads the specified component.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Initialize method is called by the design host to complete the following actions:
- Load the control designer with the component to design.
- Set up the view on the control using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.SetViewFlags%2A> method.
- Verify that the associated control is of the right type.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use a control class and a control designer class that override the Initialize method to initialize internal variables.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner_Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/7e850f1d-aadc-47e9-b073-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner_Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/7e850f1d-aadc-47e9-b073-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control is in either template viewing or editing mode in the design host. The InTemplateMode property is read-only.
Docs.value: , if the control is in either template viewing or editing mode; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A Web server control is in template mode when a read-only template is currently being viewed or an editable template is being edited in a design host such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> object to update the InTemplateMode value when the template mode changes for the associated control. Custom designers that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> class can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method to perform additional processing when the template editing mode changes for a control in the design host.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Invalidate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Invalidates the whole area of the control that is displayed on the design surface and signals the control designer to redraw the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To enable the control designer to handle paint events, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.SetViewFlags%2A> method in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method.
The Invalidate method provides the design host with a way to instruct the control designer to redraw the control. Essentially, this is the same as calling <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.UpdateDesignTimeHtml%2A> method, because it causes the whole control to be redrawn.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Invalidate(valuetype System.Drawing.Rectangle rectangle) cil managed

Docs.param: A object that represents the area to invalidate, relative to the upper-left corner of the control.
Docs.summary: Invalidates the specified area of the control that is displayed on the design surface and signals the control designer to redraw the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To enable the control designer to handle paint events, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.SetViewFlags%2A> method in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method.
The Invalidate method provides the design host with a way to instruct the control designer to redraw a specific part of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void InvokeTransactedChange (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, System.Web.UI.Design.TransactedChangeCallback callback, object context, string description);

.method public static hidebysig void InvokeTransactedChange(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, class System.Web.UI.Design.TransactedChangeCallback callback, object context, string description) cil managed

Docs.param: The control associated with the control designer.
A object representing a function to call in the control designer as part of the transaction.
An object that contains the argument for callback.
A description of the effect of allowing the transaction to complete, which is used by the design host to give the user an opportunity to cancel the transaction.
Docs.summary: Wraps a series of changes into a transaction, using the specified parameters that can be rolled back as a unit with the undo functionality of the design host.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The implementation of the InvokeTransactedChange method notifies the design host, which is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Site%2A> property of `component`, that a change is occurring in the associated control and, if the change is not canceled by the design host, invokes the specified `callback` using the specified `context`, and then notifies the design host that the change has completed.
If the design host or the associated control throws a static `Canceled` exception field of a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CheckoutException> exception, the transaction is canceled without invoking `callback`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a simple composite control with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control, together with properties to set the label text, and also the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox.Text%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Width%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control. An associated control designer class creates three <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem> commands, each of which sets two properties on the control. By using the InvokeTransactedChange method, you can use the undo functionality of the design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], to roll back each completed transaction as a unit.
[!code-vb[DesignerInvokeTransactedChange#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/84e0f50c-537e-4f50-88a0-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[DesignerInvokeTransactedChange#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/84e0f50c-537e-4f50-88a0-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static void InvokeTransactedChange (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, System.Web.UI.Design.TransactedChangeCallback callback, object context, string description, System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor member);

.method public static hidebysig void InvokeTransactedChange(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, class System.Web.UI.Design.TransactedChangeCallback callback, object context, string description, class System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor member) cil managed

Docs.param: The control associated with the control designer.
A object representing a function to call in the control designer as part of the transaction.
An object that contains the argument for callback.
A description of the effect of allowing the transaction to complete, which is used by the design host to give the user an opportunity to cancel the transaction.
A object (typically, either an or a object) that describes the member of the associated control that is being invoked as part of the transaction.
Docs.summary: Wraps a series of changes into a transaction, using the specified parameters that can be rolled back as a unit with the undo functionality of the design host.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> method notifies the design host, which is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Site%2A> property of `component`, that a change is occurring to the specified `member` (property or method) of the associated control and, if the change is not canceled by the design host, invokes the specified `callback` using the specified `context` as the argument, and then notifies the design host that the change has completed.
If the design host or associated control throws a static `Canceled` exception field of a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CheckoutException> exception, the transaction is canceled without invoking `callback`.
## Examples For a code example, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%28System.ComponentModel.IComponent%2CSystem.Web.UI.Design.TransactedChangeCallback%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.String%29>.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void InvokeTransactedChange (IServiceProvider serviceProvider, System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, System.Web.UI.Design.TransactedChangeCallback callback, object context, string description, System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor member);

.method public static hidebysig void InvokeTransactedChange(class System.IServiceProvider serviceProvider, class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, class System.Web.UI.Design.TransactedChangeCallback callback, object context, string description, class System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor member) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.IServiceProvider> object representing the design host that provides control designer services for the associated control.
The control associated with the control designer.
A object representing a function to call in the control designer as part of the transaction.
An object that contains the argument for callback.
A description of the effect of allowing the transaction to complete, which is used by the design host to give the user an opportunity to cancel the transaction.
A object (typically either an or a object) that describes the member of the associated control that is being invoked as part of the transaction.
Docs.summary: Wraps a series of changes into a transaction, using the specified parameters that can be rolled back as a unit with the undo functionality of the design host.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> method notifies the design host, which is represented by `serviceProvider`, that a change is occurring to the specified `member` (property or method) of the associated control and, if the change is not canceled by the design host, invokes the specified `callback` using the specified `context` as the argument, and then notifies the design host that the change has completed.
If the design host or the associated control throws a static `Canceled` exception field of a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CheckoutException> exception, the transaction is canceled without invoking `callback`.
## Examples For a code example, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A>.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is to use Tag.SetDirty() and Tag.IsDirty. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Web server control has been marked as changed.
Docs.value: , if the Web server control has changed since it was last persisted or loaded; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The IsDirty property is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.IsDirty%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetDirty%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A> property for equivalent control designer functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool IsPropertyBound(string propName) cil managed

Docs.param: The property to test for data binding.
Docs.summary: Retrieves a value indicating whether the specified property on the associated control is data-bound.
Docs.returns: , if the property is data-bound; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The IsPropertyBound method is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBindingCollection.Contains%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.DataBindings%2A> property for equivalent control designer functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Localize(class System.Web.UI.Design.IDesignTimeResourceWriter resourceWriter) cil managed

Docs.param: An object derived from the object that is used to write resources into the design-time response stream.
Docs.summary: Uses the provided resource writer to persist the localizable properties of the associated control to a resource in the design host.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Localize method is called by the design host to create resource entries for each property that is marked with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> object and any properties that use an explicit resource expression as a value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnAutoFormatApplied(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat appliedAutoFormat) cil managed

Docs.param: A object that defines a style.
Docs.summary: Called when a predefined, automatic formatting scheme has been applied to the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The OnAutoFormatApplied method is called after a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> object has applied a predefined format to the associated control. A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> object defines the automatic formatting scheme name and style settings that are applied to the control.
Classes deriving from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class override the OnAutoFormatApplied method to perform additional processing when an automatic formatting scheme is applied to the associated control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnBindingsCollectionChanged(string propName) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is to handle the Changed event on the DataBindings collection. The DataBindings collection allows more control of the databindings associated with the control. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.param: The property to test for changes in its bindings collection.
Docs.summary: Called when the data-binding collection changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The OnBindingsCollectionChanged method is called when the data-binding collection has been changed by an external caller.
> [!NOTE] > The OnBindingsCollectionChanged method is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBindingCollection.Changed> event on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.DataBindings%2A> collection for equivalent control designer functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnClick(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A object that specifies the location and, possibly, the control designer region that the user clicked.
Docs.summary: Called by the design host when the user clicks the associated control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event is raised by the design host for certain actions on a control in the design surface. For example, an event is raised for the following conditions:
- The user clicks the control.
- The control designer paints on the design surface.
- The user enters or exits template editing mode for the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent?displayProperty=fullName> event. Classes deriving from <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> override the OnClick method to process events that are raised when the user clicks a control.
The OnClick method allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The default implementation of the OnClick method returns without performing any processing.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use a handler for the OnClick event in a clickable region of the control and use a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs> object to identify the region that is being clicked.
This code example is part of a larger code example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> class.
[!code-vb[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/121adccd-ad5c-4b54-8217-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/121adccd-ad5c-4b54-8217-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnComponentChanged (object sender, System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs ce);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnComponentChanged(object sender, class System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs ce) cil managed

Docs.param: The source of the event.
A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Called when the associated control changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnComponentChanged method is called when a property on the associated control is changed. It allows the implementer to do any processing that might be required after a property change. Calling the OnComponentChanged method causes the design host to call the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method. The base implementation of the OnComponentChanged method also persists the control in the page markup.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnComponentChanging (object sender, System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangingEventArgs ce);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnComponentChanging(object sender, class System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangingEventArgs ce) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that is the source of the event.
A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event for the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When either the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Localize%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanging> event occurs before any changes are made to the associated control. After the changes are complete, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnControlResize() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is OnComponentChanged(). OnComponentChanged is called when any property of the control is changed. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Called when the associated Web server control has been resized in the design host at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The OnControlResize method is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method for equivalent control designer functionality.
The OnControlResize method typically is called only by the design-time environment when a user action causes the associated Web server control to be resized. The OnControlResize method might be called several times during a resizing process to display the updated size of the control before the resizing is completed. The width and height properties of the control are updated before the OnControlResize method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnPaint(class System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A object that specifies the graphics and rectangle boundaries used to draw the control.
Docs.summary: Called when the control designer draws the associated control on the design surface, if the value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event is raised by the design host for certain actions on a control in the design surface. For example, an event is raised for the following conditions:
- The user clicks the control.
- The design host requests HTML markup to render the associated control on the design surface.
- The user enters or exits template editing mode for the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent?displayProperty=fullName> event. Classes deriving from <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> should set the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewFlags?displayProperty=fullName> value and override the OnPaint method to process events that are raised when the design host draws the control on the design surface.
The OnPaint method allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The default implementation of the OnPaint method returns without performing any processing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: The properties for the class of the component.
Docs.summary: Adds properties to or removes properties from the Properties grid in a design host at design time or provides new design-time properties that might correspond to properties on the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks With the PreFilterProperties method, you can add items to the dictionary of properties that a control designer exposes through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are the names of the properties. The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RaiseResizeEvent() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Use of this method is not recommended because resizing is handled by the OnComponentChanged() method. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnControlResize%2A> event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The RaiseResizeEvent method is obsolete and there is no replacement for this feature.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is to inherit from ContainerControlDesigner instead and to use an EditableDesignerRegion. Regions allow for better control of the content in the designer. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the properties of the control are read-only at design time.
Docs.value: , if the properties of the control are read-only at design time; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class is read-only, by nature. Read/write features are provided by adding a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object or using base classes, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class.
> [!NOTE] > The ReadOnly property is obsolete. Derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class to which you can add editable designer regions or from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> object to which you can create editable designer regions in templates.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterClone (object original, object clone);
.method public hidebysig instance void RegisterClone(object original, object clone) cil managed

Docs.param: The control associated with the control designer.
The cloned copy of the associated control.
Docs.summary: Registers internal data in a cloned control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Whenever an item is cloned, there might be some internal data structures, such as `meta:` attributes, that should be included in the cloned control by the control designer. A page developer might add `meta:` attributes to the markup of a control and there is no way, nor is there a reason, for the control to distinguish what those tags might be. Therefore, if your control designer provides a way to edit complex properties or formats before applying changes to a page, you would create a clone of the control, pass both the original control and the clone to this RegisterClone method, and then, when the changes are persisted to the tag, all `meta:` attributes are also persisted.

Docs.summary: Gets the control designer for the Web Forms page that contains the associated control.
Docs.value: A object that can be used at design time to access components on the Web Forms page that contains the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The RootDesigner property represents the control designer for the Web Forms page that contains the control. Use the RootDesigner property to access and manipulate the containing Web Forms page at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed

Docs.param: An editable design region contained within the control.
The content to assign for the editable design region.
Docs.summary: Specifies the content for an editable region of the control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Classes deriving from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class can support region-based editing on the design surface and override the SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method to set the content for a specified region.
## Examples The following code example shows how to get a reference to the design host, and then use the reference to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlParser> object that turns `content` into an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITemplate> interface and assigns the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITemplate> instance to the appropriate view.
[!code-vb[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/b626e5ea-50b4-4a42-b854-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/b626e5ea-50b4-4a42-b854-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected void SetRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method familyhidebysig instance void SetRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed

Docs.param: An editable design region contained within the design-time view of the control.
The content to assign for the editable design region.
Docs.summary: Specifies the content for an editable region in the design-time view of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Normally, the SetRegionContent method is not overridden in derived designers. The base class causes the design host to call the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method for the region. Override the SetRegionContent method when custom data is required for the control before calling <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.
Use the SetRegionContent method to insert HTML markup into a region of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void SetViewFlags (System.Web.UI.Design.ViewFlags viewFlags, bool setFlag);
.method familyhidebysig instance void SetViewFlags(valuetype System.Web.UI.Design.ViewFlags viewFlags, bool setFlag) cil managed

Docs.param: A value.
to set the flag, to remove the flag.
Docs.summary: Assigns the specified bitwise enumeration to the specified flag value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks There are several flags that can be set. For example, use the SetViewFlags method to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewFlags> value of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property for the control designer, instead of the obsolete <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.DesignTimeHtmlRequiresLoadComplete%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the SetViewFlags method to indicate that the template is in editing mode.
[!code-cs[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/cdc3546f-64fc-4593-a579-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/cdc3546f-64fc-4593-a579-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets an object representing the HTML markup element for the associated control.
Docs.value: An object that represents the HTML markup element for the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, the Tag property is used only for communication between the design host and the control designer and is not used by control developers.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of template groups, each containing one or more template definitions.
Docs.value: A collection of objects. The default is an empty .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a control designer class that derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class. This control designer supports a control with four possible templates.
To try it, compile the code, and then, in a design host such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], view the page in Design view. Select the control, click the action list to select a template to modify, and then use the drag-and-drop feature to move controls into the template.
[!code-cs[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.design.c_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.design.c_1_1.vb)] [!code-vb[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.design.c_1_2.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Refreshes the design-time HTML markup for the associated Web server control by calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The UpdateDesignTimeHtml method is called by the design host to update the display of the associated Web server control at design time, such as when the control has been modified. Also, a control designer can call the UpdateDesignTimeHtml method after modifying values of the control to update the display of the control.
> [!NOTE] > If you are calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event, or using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> object to set properties, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService> interface calls the UpdateDesignTimeHtml method for you.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to respond to a `Click` event in a control designer to change the focus between regions in a multi-region control and use the UpdateDesignTimeHtml method to update the appearance of the control in the design host.
This code example is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> class.
[!code-vb[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.c_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.design.c_1_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control designer uses a temporary preview control to generate the design-time HTML markup.
Docs.value: , if the control designer uses a temporary copy of the control for design-time preview; otherwise, , if the control designer uses the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Component%2A> property for the control contained in the control designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the UsePreviewControl property is `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property returns a temporary copy of the control. Changes to the temporary control are not persisted to the document.
If the UsePreviewControl property is `false`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property returns an instance of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Component%2A> property for the control. Changes to the instance of the control are persisted.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute.SupportsPreviewControl%2A> setting in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> object is used to set the value of the UsePreviewControl property. Therefore, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute.SupportsPreviewControl%2A> setting determines the type of control that is returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property in the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> is not specified in the control designer declaration, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> object behavior is equivalent to specifying the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute.SupportsPreviewControl%2A> property as `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Web server control that can be used for previewing the design-time HTML markup.
Docs.value: A object used by the base class to generate design-time HTML markup.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ViewControl property uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property to determine its return value.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is `true`, the ViewControl property returns a temporary copy of the control. Changes to the temporary control are not persisted.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is `false`, the ViewControl property returns an instance of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Component%2A> property for the control. Changes to the instance of the control are persisted.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute.SupportsPreviewControl%2A> setting in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> object is used to set the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property. Therefore, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute.SupportsPreviewControl%2A> setting determines the type of control that is returned by the ViewControl property in the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> is not specified in the control designer declaration, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> object behavior is equivalent to specifying the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute.SupportsPreviewControl%2A> property as `false`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to mark a control designer with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> attribute. The code example derives a Web server control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> class and associates the control with a custom control designer implementation. The control designer class declaration is marked with the `SupportsPreviewControl` attribute set to `true`. The control designer overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method, and then displays the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label.Text%2A> property of the control in italic at design time.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.design.c_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.design.c_3_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ViewControlCreated { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a control has been created for display on the design surface.
